Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Week in London”
Reviews.Author: Kemal G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. Its location is perfect, rooms are very clean and adequately furnished, breakfast is good and prisec are very reasonable. Most importantly, staff, especially manager Jale Swailes, are very friendly. I enjoyed my stay very much and hope to go back. Kemal Gürüz

Reviews.Title: “good location poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: scouse584
Reviews.Content: when were the photos taken of this hotel ? i stayed there only 3 weeks ago and the hotel did not resemble the photos at all. the general appearance of the place was sad and shabby. the furniture in the bedroom was scratched and grubby. i did not remove my shoes as the carpets were dirty and the bathroom sad and dated. dont venture past the kitchen - it was a disgrace ! staff sour faced and miserable. the location is good and if you have been out sightseeing all day and just want somewhere to sleep this hotel is fine - dont take someone there for a romantic getaway - you will probably get dumped!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: titetshirt
Reviews.Content: Considering the location and being handy for Marble Arch tube, this hotel is the pits. From walking in and being greeted by a surly receptionist in a dull dark and dingy lounge area. Being told the lift is that way and finding the smallest lift I have ever seen, wondering if it will get to the 1st floor never mind the 3rd. Made it to the room eventually with no signage and a rabbit warren of corridors, the room was a shock. A brand new huge flat screen TV and a hotel room that looks like the £300 it cost for the TV could of been better spent on the room. The room is noisy small and not worth £20 a night. The bathroom was so small it was almost impossible to turn the taps on the bath without getting in the bath. Dove soap dispensers in the bath which the cleaner doesn't examine because they are in need of a damp cloth and some elbow grease. I didn't venture down for breakfast because basically I value my stomach and don't wanna risk food poisoning.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice”
Reviews.Author: ScheryW
Reviews.Content: In spite of the great location, can't recommend. The single ensuite was tiny, the shower mini, the lift ancient, the corridors narrow. 'Breakfast included' was a half-truth. A buffet breakfast was laid out but on checking out I was charged for the scrambled eggs! No sign over the buttet warned guests that the hot food was extra!!! Shameful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected:)”
Reviews.Author: kristin1006
Reviews.Content: I went there for 4 nights in August. We were 4 girls just looking for a place to sleep and a place to keep our luggage. We found it when browsing for cheap hotels in London. We did not read all the reviews until after we had booked the hotel and there were not that many good reviews so I was afraid this would be a mess. BUT it turned out to be just really good, the location could not be better, we were about 5 mins walk away from Oxford st., the staff was nice and the room was clean! So I cannot complain, I would definitely go there again. Of course my expectations were not high for a 2 star hotel, but Good hotel for very low price!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but fine”
Reviews.Author: LILYandSAMHongKong
Reviews.Content: For the price you mustn't grumble. The staff were super friendly and helpful which made the stay fine. Ok the rooms are a bit shabby and could do with a lick of paint for the price and location it's fine. Breakfast was basic and we did not choose the fried option as there's plenlty of good places to eat close by. For the price - it's great

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: mckinnels
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had the displeasure of staying here for 2 nights in June. Our room was on the 3rd floor. The lift was so tiny, it would only accomodate us both with a suitcase each and that was a tight squeeze. We did not feel safe using it, so climbed the stairs each time we left or returned to our room. They were very narrow and steep. Our room was so small that you could only open the ensuite door half way as it hit one of the twin beds. Decor was shabby and very dated. The room smelt musty and the bathroom was a disgrace. It smelt like the sewers. The shower curtain was not big enough and so water leaked everywhere. The shower was useless as the water trickeled out and fluctuated between red hot and freezing cold. Breakfast was very basic. As we had pre paid the booking we stuck it out. The location was great, but thats all I can say was good about our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Robhi
Reviews.Content: I was booked in for a night on a business trip. If it hadn't been late on arrival I would have turned and left right then. The hotel is tired and dated, with marks and dents an the Walls. My room was furnished with a twin bed , complete with a blanket with holes in. Breakfast was very woeful and consisted of the option of two cereals and toast, branded up as a continental breakfast. All in all i cant believe they charge what thye do. Honestly don't bother, there are better places in the area for the same or less.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Campbell
Reviews.Content: I was given a room on the fourth floor of this hotel. It was only accessible by taking a small elevator up to the third floor and then the steps to the next floor or by taking the steps all the way. The room was tiny and had a musty smell. The only way I could get the free wireless internet was to stand out in the stairwell with my laptop or go down to the lobby. It is a very old hotel and does not in my opinion warrant the price they charge for a room. I was booked in to this hotel for three nights and after seeing my room I checked out and vowed never to return. It is far from value for money. The local tour office booked the hotel for me and I did not read the bad reviews until after it was booked. I would certainly have stayed away if I had read them before hand. The only good thing about this hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, but don't expect up to the minute furnishings and decoration.”
Reviews.Author: patrickzero
Reviews.Content: I got good friendly and attentive service here, and would recommend the hotel for that alone. The standard of furniture and general decorative standard is not great, however the rooms seemed clean, with fresh bed linen, plenty of clean towels and all the facilities worked (incl. a good strong, hot shower!). Reception even telephoned next morning to remind me that the free on-street car parking was about to come to an end. Good location for reaching most of central London. What I liked most was the service, clean linen and good shower. What I like least was the general decor, and no upright chair to work at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel for West End of London”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkBoatman Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on a business trip. This is an old, well worn hotel, my room and bathroom were small but clean. The breakfast was basic but perfectly ok. My room overlooked Cumberland Place, so there was quite a lot of traffic noise, but this did not really bother me. At the rate I paid - Â£95, I regarded it as very fair, particularly taking into account the position, 5 min walk from Marble Arch Tube and Park Lane

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location,okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: hei019
Reviews.Content: Had read only positive reviews beforehand,now I see several have complained about rats etc., my own review is somewhere in the middle here. On the plus side: EXCELLENT location! 100 metres or so to Marble Arch/Oxford street and underground station with direct line to Liverpool str,couldn't be more perfect if your flight goes to/from Stanstead!Okay-sized room, I had requested twin beds and we got both a double and a single,both with comfortable mattresses, everything clean,fresh towels and sheets every day,coffee/tea-making facilities. However,everything rickety-rackety: the toilet seat ring did not fit the toilet, one hook on the bathroom door hang in one screw only (the other hook had fallen off),when pulling the light chord on the light fixture above the basin,the entire thing was pulled askew and had to be pushed up, the bathroom door lock, a sliding bolt,had come loose etc. Breakfast was minimal,but plenty of excellent grab-and-go food places (Pret a Manger/Subway/KFC/ Starbucks/ right at Marble Arch so this did not matter at all. Staff polite, but that's all. We would definitely stay here again, just for the superb location, as we had no nasty rat/mice/bug /dirt experiences here! A great tip for everyone visiting London: Bus nr 23 goes from Marble Arch almost all through the centre of London in both direction: from Millennium Bridge/ST.Paul's in the eastern parts to Notting Hill and Portobello Road Market, passing by all important tourists' sites like Trafalgar Sq, National Gallery,Haymarket (the theatre are), Kensington Gardens (opposite the Kensington Palace,just a short walk thru the park). Buy a day ticket for London transport (at approx 6 pounds per person it's a STEAL) and forget all about expensive tourist buses!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: chrisdonovan
Reviews.Content: I was at Rose Court for Christmas with my girlfriend just bored of being in New York every year and to see London. I booked the place from internet and was one of the good ones. It is in a great location walkaway distance to many places, rooms are very clean and staff are really friendly. Whenever I needed something, helpful staff got that for me. Nice city, nice place, clean room, friendly people, good food, good wine is the summary of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: Eunal
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb, just beside Marble Arch, which makes travelling so easy. Literally 1-2 minutes to Oxford Street, the metro and trhe bus connections. The service is very good too. Especially the reception provides very good advice and tries to solve your problems asap! (even using their own personal connections!). The rooms are very clean and I had a very pleasant wekend. Due to the enormous rates at central London, I had tended to stay not as central in my previous trips. But Rose Court Hotel solved this for me too. What you get in return of the considerably lower rates you pay is almost too good to be true. I do recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business stay”
Reviews.Author: Saurabh_36
Reviews.Content: Great stay, excellent location, good room and nice staff. I've stayed in a few hotels in London and this is by far the best!! Staff were courteous, polite and went the extra mile to make it special..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Cozy & Cheap Hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: PerkyNomad
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 4 month old son & I stayed in one room and our travel companions, another couple, stayed here as well. We flew in separately and played message with the hotel desk 'tag' & the hotel staff was so helpful. They had our rooms moved to the same floor and had our travel cot for our son ready when we got there. The rooms are small, but very comfortable. There was enough drawers & hangers in the armoire for all of our things. The bathroom had a full tub which made bathing our 4 month old son much easier than if it had been a stall shower. The continental breakfast was cereal, toast, coffee, tea & orange juice. It's good enough to get something in your belly before finding a real breakfast. There's a great chain fresh-food called Pret A Manger on the corner. The best feature about this hotel has to be the great location along the Underground's Central Line & many Public Bus lines. This is a cozy hotel to get quality sleep while touring in London. If you aren't interested in a hostel-type stay, but price is important, then this is the next best bet. There is another hotel of the same name, this is the one on Cumberland. (Down the street from some very posh hotels)

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel @ the best location in London !! Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: sanyaToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Everything was way beyond my expectations!! Service, hotel staff&management, cleanliness (ppl mentioning the problem with mice probably had delirium tremens ) , location, value, everything was simply the best !!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable break”
Reviews.Author: simbayakenya
Reviews.Content: Nice location. No complaints. Was a bit aprehensive having read the reviews about the mice. Since paid in advance I took my chances as manager assured that pest control maintenance had eradicated the problem. Room was a bit small but clean. Staff was polite and helpful in advice for getting around the city. Overall good price according to location. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “please dont go”
Reviews.Author: bcfcfanandy
Reviews.Content: basically if this hotel wasnt in london you would pay Â£10 per night here and even then you would feel ripped of.i have never ever stayed in such a dirty< small smelly place in my life.shower didnt work< found a half dead rat on the top of the stairs,no clean sheets,RUDE staff,breakfast beyond a joke,tv didnt work and the smell of the whole place is horendous.i made the mistake of not reading the reviews before going here but please take on board what people are telling you,this isnt a hotel its not even good enough to call it a homeless shelter.when i return to london i will be paying the extra Â£80 and staying in a hilton.this place shouldnt be aloud to stay open its a disgrace. oh and the walls have stains EVERYWHERE on them. ripped of and felt so dirty sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “take care you might find a Rat in your room”
Reviews.Author: Belco_10
Reviews.Content: Forget the benefit of the good location. I found a Rat in my room , and I knew later on that there is a lot of rats & mouses inside the hotel, by the way I went to this hotel 3 times because of the location but I left the hotel after the 3rd night, I will never come back to this hotel even if I will be invited on complimentary basis. The reception staff is good especialy Mohamed but that can not do anything with a old dated hotel full of rats and mouses . Do not take the risque to go I should consider that this hotel is not recommanded by other guests but I did not & I took the wrong choice. Breakfast is very poor, rooms are very old,bathroom is very small , the hotel has a very bad smell. Think twice before booking this hotel, if you have low budget search by street name on google .

Reviews.Title: “PEST PEST PEST”
Reviews.Author: alibaba101
Reviews.Content: The motel is located close to the central Marble Arch Tube. But unfortunately... was in the wrong room. There is a mouse hole under the bed of Rm 305!

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable with safety issues”
Reviews.Author: mz_shazzababy
Reviews.Content: initial response was very old place but london is old city my teenage children were horrified by room small really old tv which didnt work ,hairdryer didnt work cord to light in bathroom caused light to flicker then dripping heard, water started coming through cord my son got zapped turning it off. After complaining got changed to other room marginally bigger but in a rabbit warren of abasement beautiful view 4 bikes and a pile of garbage bags shower nearly coming of,f wall but worked, towels changed everyday of our three day, stay could access wifi but that was the only pros. lift was 2 person lift and extremely difficult with luggage on day of leaving observed arriving visitors reactions ranged from perplexed to horrified wasnt as if it was really cheap rates i have complained to my travel agent dont book if you want some home comforts

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charmaineSomerset
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews concerning bedbugs, surly staff and threadbare carpets, I couldn't wait to try this hotel. I was sorely disappointed. The sheets were clean, there was a generous supply of clean towels, the bed very comfortable, more than adequate milk cartons (something hotels are usually very mean on) and the staff were, without exception, helpful and friendly. There was always a smile for you upon returning to the hotel. Upon arrival, a young man was summoned to carry my small suitcase up to my room - an old fashioned practice not found in some more expensive hotel. It is true the carpet was worn in places and the paintwork has seen better days. There appears to be some renovation taking place in the area of one of the main staircases as modern wood panelling had been placed on the lower part of the walls. This was, I fear, a mistake and out of keeping in a town house such as the Rose Court. The restoration and decoration of these elegant houses, even when used as hotels, needs to be researched. The hotel appears to lack a housekeeper and a DIY man. Traditionally, the housekeeper's job was to check each room, etc. for any fault (however slight) and get it fixed (this is where the DIY man came in). In my room, the housekeeper would have found the basin plug did not fit and that some wretched child, upon entering the room, had left their sticky finger marks on the wall . I would think these two jobs could be absorbed by the current staff. The small lounge had a supply of tourist leaflets, large TV and two comfortable settees. Some magazines would have been nice. They do not have to be up-to-date or expensive - just something to while away a short time. Some fresh or potted flowers would have been nice. Again these do not have to be expensive. The dining room could have been the original dining room and had two large windows which made the room quite light. The basic breakfast was included in the price. However, a cooked breakfst was available for an extra charge. The UK and London in particular is now expensive and the cost of maintaining these town houses is high. People seem to forget that the bill they pay is not the hotel's own turnover. There is VAT at 17 1/2% and the business rate. I suspect that, of the Â£75 I paid, the hotel received maybe Â£60. Then there is the burden of implementing the never ending legislation which now emanates from the EU . This always includes a healthy dose of paperwork which nobody ever looks at. I hope the above points will be helpful to the hotel in developing their trade and I only wish that some of the other commentators thought before they put key to computer screen.

Reviews.Title: “Not somewhere to relax”
Reviews.Author: OZfriend
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location, within walking distance of tube station & many attractions availability of tourist information - brochures & bookings through reception free wifi cosy public lounge Clean bathroom Cons: in desperate need of renovation can hear people in adjacent rooms (floors creaking, yelling etc) water temperature of shower fluctuates significantly very basic breakfast selection very narrow stairs & tiny lift

Reviews.Title: “Homely, safe and familiar at start, central location, Economic with worth services”
Reviews.Author: Rugbylondon
Reviews.Content: I was new to UK and not knowing any thing here. By chance i took this place first time when i came in july and stayed for three days. I felt quite familiar and homely from day one. It's in central London and most of things are in easy approach from here. The nearest tube station is at walking distance and so also nearby markets,restaurents etc. Its quite economic priced with worth hotel services. The staff and Managers are worth special mention who always are polite and helpful. The breakfast was free and the rooms though not big are comfortable and cozy. There was 24/7 free Internet inside room(WIFI). If you are planning comfort and economy together, then I suppose this could be the best choice. I liked it so much that NEXT TIME I CAME AND STAYED WITH MY WIFE HERE IN SEP., 2009. It was again a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sid35
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever encountered. The place was dirty, carpets threadbare, tv in room didn't work, breakfast appalling. The whole experience was awful and the place should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm56
Reviews.Content: Adding bars to the windows would make it an idea prison cell. I slept on top of the bed, I opened up the bedspread and quickly closed it again. God only knows what horrors lie beneath. The room was filthy and needed an all over clean. wallpaper was coming away from the wall. people above walking aroind sounded like a herd of elephants, and I am sure I did, too, to the room below. Next morning in the breakfast hall, which was also filthy, one of the staff merrily went about their work with their mobile phone stuck to their ear. Coffe was lukewarm and no choice of bread, thin while toast. I wouldn't want my worst enemy to stay there! What a poor example of British hospitality (no Brits working there anyway - im sure!) to foreign visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Huskador
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rose Court in July this year for 2 nights with my two best friends. The hotel itself is basic but clean, although it could do with a spruce up, new furniture and fixtures/painting etc, but the hotel is good value for money and you only get what you pay for. The continental breakfast was average. The hotel has free wifi in all the rooms which is great, just nip down to reception and ask for the password. The location is excellent, you are a two min walk from Marble Arch tube station on Oxford street and really close to the shops! I would recommend this for friends after a cheap place to stay in London, don't come here if you plan to spend any time in your room, this was just a base for sightseeing and shopping for us!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CalleSpain_Zaragoza
Reviews.Content: I have experiencied a nice time during my trip to London, this hotel offered me a nice stay with a clean and very organized rooms. The location is fantastic and easy to get around in the city. The people in the hotel is very friendly and always keen to help us regarding information and other info about the city.This hotel is in my list not only for me but also for my colleagues next time in London.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cheinho
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for a three night stay. Staf were helpful and friendly. The hotel is minutes from Marble Arch tube station on Oxford St and it makes easy to get around for shopping and sightseein plus custo is reasonable. I willl recommend this to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: pasink
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks ago, I was in London for a business trip with my girlfriend who spent most of her time sightseeing. We stayed in Rose Court hotel marble arch for 4 nights. My friend from moscow recommended me this hotel because it has a perfect location in the very center of the city with a reasonable price. after my business meetings we easily could access to restaurants and shopping center on oxford street. hotel provided free wi-fi, which is not common for me because in most of european countries all hotels charge for this service. both my girlfriend and i were happy with the rooms, cleaniness and the smiling service. i will stay there when i go back to london. Sergey Chernikov . Moscow

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: moonsturkey
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok and clean. I think it is a nice place to stay if you want to be in the center of the city and don't want to pay much.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: carb0
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the hotel through the recommendation of a friend. And I was not let down. It is good value for the money. Location is central and walking distance from Oxford Street. Reception staff are friendly & helpful. Room & bathroom were clean with the usual menities.Overall I would recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Save Yourself!”
Reviews.Author: mondotuna
Reviews.Content: Left about midnight after killing the 11th bedbug and stayed on the cold Paddington Station streets for a few hours until I found a ride to Heathrow. The trains don't run until 5:30am. Thought about just staying in the room with the light on and exectuing the little buggers when they came out, but I noticed one crawling on my luggage and the idea I'd be taking them home decided it for me. The photos of blood on the sheets are I believe the residue of other executions. That's the way my sheets looked (but fresher blood, hopefully mine) when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Room”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_B0Y
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this hotel for me. Initially there was a mix up with my booking which finally got sorted(long story which is for another day). Here I just want comment on the room. As I approached it via the 2 person lift , the narrow hallways and stairs, alarm bells in my head were already ringing. It had grubby and unkept appearance. As I opened the room door I was prepared for the worst and so it was. The room was an unusual shape, longish and narrow. The wallpaper was dull and ancient. My attention was then immediately drawn to the bed. The blanket was very old and dirty looking, as was the headboard. There was an old wardrobe at the foot of the bed which looked like it was ready to fall over at any moment. The room had a real dark and depressing feel to it. I had a quick glimpse into the bathroom which was bigger than the room itself before I decided to go back and investigate the sheets on the bed. As I pulled back the old top blanket the sheets underneath surprisingly looked cleaned but then the lights went out and I was in the dark. Maybe that was the best way to view the room. After ten minutes I had enough so I picked up my back, walked down to reception, returned my key and left. Stayed in a much nicer and cheaper hotel about 15 minutes walk from there. It is amazing what hotels like the Rose Court ,Great Cumberland Place can get away with.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: oapwill
Reviews.Content: I booked this at the last minute through the recomendation of Travel Republic. Never again! After arriving around 6pm ( it was cold and dark) I was looking forward to staying overnight in London. Being a solo traveller I just didn't feel confident enough to look for alternative accomodation at that time of night. The room was faded splendour indeed. Torn wallpaper chipped paintwork and what looked like blood splatter up 2 of the walls! Blankets were filthy but the sheets did look clean. The headboard was also filthy and of the old padded buttonback variety! The shower over the bath was 'protected' by a glass screen which made it impossible to turn on the taps unless you were actually standing in the bath underneath it! The taps were caked in lime scale and hadn't been cleaned since installed. Breakfast room was like a small works canteen. I don't know what the brown stuff that they called coffee actually was. I was charge Â£125 for 1 night here and will never set foot in the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: kitten1983
Reviews.Content: I booked this from a last minute hotel booking website for me, my partner and a work colleague. We got two rooms in the hotel after our work Xmas party. We just wanted somewhere clean and cheap, and are generally not fussy when we stay in London, which we do often on a budget. The room my partner and I stayed in was surprisingly large with high ceilings and a big window, and so has the potential to be really lovely. Unfortunately though the decor and general state of repair let it down. I'm not sure of the room number, but our room had a large mirror right opposite the bed, which was really disconcerting and gave you the feeling of being watched which wasn't pleasant. There was a double bed in the room and an extra single, the bedlinen was clean but looked old and the bed was incredibly uncomfortable and creaked every time you moved, making it near impossible to sleep. I tried sleeping in the single and it was the same. The en suite was very small, but I expect that for the price and it was no problem for us. It was quite grubby though and the whole place could do with a refresh. The final test of a good hotel is always the tea and coffee making facilities, but they provided whitening instead of milk and the kettle wasn't clean, so we didn't go there! We didn't want to stay for breakfast and when we met up with my colleague in the morning, she was equally unimpressed and had left her room at 6.30am because she didn't feel comfortable there. It did the job for one night, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Yes Great No”
Reviews.Author: dawny66
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap hotel in a good location in London, not something easy to find. Next time I will pay more and stay somewhere Nicer. Don't get me wrong the location was great, just off Oxford St near Marble Arch, the staff were friendly. The room however was on the top floor up some very creaky stairs, you can hear what time people go to bed! The room was clean but very small. wallpaper was starting to come away from the wall and the curtains could have benefited from a wash. The breakfast was toast and cereal, hot breakfast extra - fair enough for the price paid, but please just put the nets at the dining room window through the washing machine. This could be such a quaint homely hotel should it have some money spent on bringing it up to date, but for one night was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Britabroad6363
Reviews.Content: Having travelled from Portugal for a relaxing weekend this Hotel was a tremendous dissapointment. In London for the shops, see a show and take in the atmosphere.The location of the Hotel was good but the remainder was not good. The entrance was dirty, the reception was dark and dated, the lift was "minute" (and felt somewhat unstable), the room was so small that my wife and I could not enter one after the other without closing and re opening the door, the decor was dirty, the bathroom was dated, very small and in need of a good clean and upgrade. The bedding was dated and the bed was not very comfortable. We were in London for 3 nights, we stayed in this very dissapointing venue for 30 minutes - just long enough to book a replacement over the phone and get a cab. There are lots of Hotels in London dont make the same mistake we did - simply do not go there!

Reviews.Title: “Got the Job Done”
Reviews.Author: hollydc13
Reviews.Content: This was a good deal. Through Expedia I booked w/ my fiance a round trip ticket to London along with 6 night stay in this hotel. Total: $995 a person. Just what I could afford. And I got exactly what I paid for. I'm happy. I was nervous going here because I read the reviews about it being dirty, mice, bed bugs etc. I didn't experience any of this. It was a bit shabby, and definitely cramped quarters, but we were literally using the place to hold our stuff, shower and sleep. And it did well for all those things. The beds are hard, I agree, although I've heard that hard beds are better for your back. I still like softer beds. After walking around all day and sight-seeing i could have been sleeping on the floor and still slept soundly. There is no AC,but it was so nice and cool out we just opened the window and got a wonderful breeze. The bathroom was so tiny. Smaller then my NYC apartment bathroom. The shower was a little grimy but i'm young and don't complain. I showered. The sink made me laugh every time i saw it, because it was so tiny. Also the door lock was fun because the hole would be green or red (depending on if someone was in there or not) The tv had 5 stations. BBC all the way. The breakfast was fine. England coffee sucks...good luck finding good coffee anywhere in that country. The toast was really good, as was the jam. Cereal was good. Wasn't a fan of the eggs and beans but I know that is their culture to eat that kind of food so I will not complain, but be happy I could try something that wasn't american. Since the breakfast was free we saved probably 20$ a day on breakfast. London is so expensive, so finding a deal like this allowed me to shop more (which is my priority) :) So all in all, I am very glad I found this deal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but shabby”
Reviews.Author: jasmanda
Reviews.Content: We were a family party of two adults and two children staying for a short break on a fairly tight budget. The Rose Court reception staff were helpful and friendly and showed a genuine interest in whether we were enjoying our stay. The room was too hot, at the top of 4 flights of stairs (or a trip in a very precarious looking lift!) and was very shabby. That said, the sheets and towels were clean and the breakfast was basic but edible. Do not stay in this hotel if you intend the accomodation to contribute much to your impression of London. Do stay in this hotel if you are a student backpacker or needing a cheap bed for the night in a central location and you are not fussy about the age of the furniture/decor. We have stayed in better youth hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for little money, good location”
Reviews.Author: LMic
Reviews.Content: We wanted a family room for 4 persons, and this was the cheapest we could find on the net in central London. The hotel and the room looked run down - old furniture, old TV, trashy curtains and carpets, only the bathroom was up to date. Beds were OK. However service was fine, the staff very friendly, the room was cleaned properly every day, breakfast OK and included in the price. And location was great, 2 minutes walk to Oxford street, Underground (Marble Arch), Hyde Park, close to many busses and restaurants (Tip: Italian restaurant â€œCaffe Unoâ€�, 11 Edgware Road was the best deal of the 8 restaurants we visited in London). Noise level from street etc. was low. If you are looking for a cheap room in a good location, saving your money for entertainment or shopping, this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “hurry up breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mel46
Reviews.Content: Date 28 June 2007 Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. As a 2 star hotel, the location was great:-10 mins walk from tube (Central Line) and buses. Room, as expected form other reviews, was small and bathroom tiny . Also dark . Glad it wasn't hot weather as might be stifling. Had requested a larger room but this was hardly that!!! Main complaint was about breakfast. Scheduled for 7-9am, went down at 8.50 to find only allowed 1 cup of coffee , toast that had barely winked at the toaster and to be told to 'please eat quickly' as the servers were finishing at 9 ! When I queried this, i was informed that the servers ' were only paid until 9 and had other work to do.' Needless to say, did not bother the other mornings. If you want a cheap convenient hotel, this is OK but certainly no frills and not particularly hospitable staff

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing”
Reviews.Author: Tarvismike
Reviews.Content: I can't find any other word that fits how I felt staying in the Rose Court. I was led to a basement room with my four friends by a receptionist who was very confused about our booking. The room's windows looked onto a grimy alley 6 foot below the pavement, so at night there were footsteps and traffic noises coming through our window which wouldn't fully close. There was a picture of a sinister-looking man holding a child above my bed that I took down as soon as I got in the room. The beds were stained with something that seemed to be blood, but I didn't want to think too much about that. When we turned on the propeller fan, one of the beds got a fresh coat of dust thrown onto it. There were wardrobes and presses which wouldn't open no matter how much we tried. Luckily, we only stayed for one night and I wouldn't recommend any longer.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Filmstudent
Reviews.Content: Myself and five freinds recently stayed in the Rose Court during a recent trip to London (feb 28 - march 3 2007). I can honestley say that the hotel was far better thn any of us expected it to be. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't have done any more to be helpful towards us. The hotel is situated very close to marble arch tube station and from there it is a short journey to anywhere in the city, alternativley it's great location allows you to walk almost anywhere you might want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very basic”
Reviews.Author: chelle1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while visiting london. Overall it was ok. Had a few problems on arrival and the nightman/receptionist had not 1 clue about checking somebody in. He could not speak english but we got our room in the end. The lift was shocking, i would recommend taking the stairs because it is on the virge of breaking down. The rooms are small but they are fine for the price.. We had a twin room for the first night and a triple for the second night and the triple was definately alot better. It was a clean hotel and the bathroom in the triple room was very spacious but tiny in the twin room. Location of the hotel was brilliant. It is just around the corner from Oxford street with great shopping and you can walk to Picadilly circus and Leicester square where all the night life is. If you are on a budget and dont mind where you stay then it is fine but if you can get something in the same area with similar price then take that instead. Would I stay here again? Yes if I was badely stuck

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cliveocr
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews remain broadly appropriate. Also, I found there was a lot of noise from the traffic during the night.

Reviews.Title: “dingy rose court”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i cannot tell you how disappointed we were with the rose court hotel. The place is realy dirty and drab, our room net curtains were full of holes and frayed the paintwork is chipped and dirty and the carpet should be totally refurbished. The tv system which only get 4 channels were hooked to a roof antenna which was not postioned properly and none of the staions came in clear. On the positive side the staff were nice and friendly and somewhat embarassed by the amenities offered by the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Rose Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 35/35a Great Cumberland Place | Marble Arch, London W1H 7DS, England
